critique: This document is an executive order that exempts a government employee from mandatory retirement. It does not seem to have any significant implications for ideological tilt, immigration, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The only axis that it touches on is executive power, as it is an example of the executive branch using its authority to make a decision about a government employee. However, this is a fairly routine action and does not represent a significant expansion of executive power.
